sentences.en: Agency France Presse enjoys great popularity both at home and abroad.
sentences.cn: 法新社在国内外都很有名气.

sentences.en: Hemmings is enjoying a newfound popularity as a character actor in the movies.
sentences.cn: 作为电影界的一名性格演员，亨明斯最近开始走红。

sentences.en: In his day , Mendoza enjoyed tremendous popularity.
sentences.cn: 门杜萨在全盛时期极受人们欢迎.

sentences.en: In politics, power and popularity are not synonymous.
sentences.cn: 在政治上，权力和声望并非相依而存。

sentences.en: It is his popularity with ordinary people that sets him apart.
sentences.cn: 正是他在普通民众中的声望使他与众不同。

sentences.en: Our product enjoys popularity throughout the world.
Raquel Welch was at the height of her popularity as a sex goddess.
sentences.cn: 拉克尔·韦尔奇作为一名性感女神红极一时。

sentences.en: Several unpopular decisions diminished the governor's popularity.
sentences.cn: 几项不得人心的决定使州长的声望下降.

sentences.en: Some analysts estimate its current popularity at around ten per cent.
sentences.cn: 一些分析家估计它现在的普及率在10%左右。

sentences.en: The boom in the sport's popularity has meant more calls for stricter safety regulations.
sentences.cn: 该项体育运动的兴起意味着制定更加严格的安全规则的呼声更高了。
骑自行车运动的日益风行

sentences.en: The president’s popularity has declined considerably.
sentences.cn: 总统的支持率大大下降了。

sentences.en: The president's popularity nationally is at an all-time low.
sentences.cn: 总统在全国的人气目前正处于历史最低点。

sentences.en: There are indications that his esoteric popularity may be ebbing.
sentences.cn: 有迹象表明,他神秘的声望可能正在下降.

sentences.en: They brought in new tax laws in a bid to restore their popularity.
sentences.cn: 他们提出了新税法,力求重新赢得人心.

sentences.en: Walking and golf increased in popularity during the 1980s.
sentences.cn: 在20世纪80年代越来越多的人喜欢上了远足或是打高尔夫球。

words.tran_cn: 流行的，通俗的；受欢迎的；大众的；普及的
流行地；通俗地；普及地；大众地
流行音乐；汽水；砰然声；枪击
大众化的人；普及读物；普及者；使普及的人
突然出现；爆开；射击；瞪大；发出爆裂声
推广，普及；使…通俗化（等于popularize）；使…受欢迎
取出；开枪打；抛出；突然伸出；突然行动
普及，流行；名气；受大众欢迎

trans.tran_en: when something or someone is liked or supported by a lot of people
